topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537913246368726aa41e0100#post_537913246368726aa41e0100
I heard Iceland went got hit by the Black Plague twice during the Middle Ages. Suffered inbreeding due to their small and isolated population. And was one of the poorest countries in Europe back then. A good number of men went as far as the Byzantine Empire and served under the Greeks as mercenaries called the Varangian Guards, which consisted of largely Germanic people from Northern Europe.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53791bbf63687275156b0100#post_53791bbf63687275156b0100
I have to disagree with these news studies in that IQ is the old way of studying human intelligence.  Just cause someone has a high IQ doesn't mean they aren't intelligent in one thing.  I'm trying to remember what the new way they study intelligence is, but it instead measures the person's intelligence in particular subjects and so forth.

I'm trying real hard to remember what the new way of measuring a person's intelligence is called, but I can't for the life of me remember.
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53791d2d6368727469550200#post_53791d2d6368727469550200
Nope; Britain was inhabited for a extremely long time; I'm not exactly sure for how long.  Possibly as far back as 700000BC.  They got butchered though.  So no sorry British, but you're not actually British.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53791e04636872695d2b0300#post_53791e04636872695d2b0300
They are British because British commonly refers to the people who settled later.
Germans didn't always live in Germany but it became a German country when they did.
But I understand what you mean and all I put forth was a linguistic argument.

And IQ is flawed but it is flawed because it is more sophisticated than given credit for.
For example, the reason it focuses on only a few areas is because of G. Essentially, all of these areas are influenced by the G score, meaning if you're good at one you tend to be good at the others as well.

It's still a useful measure for general intelligence and, as far as I know, the most reliable one we have.
It could easily be supplanted by a better test but most of the time it is attacked for ideological reasons
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5379235c6368727ea3340100#post_5379235c6368727ea3340100
they exist outside of IQ and I don't know much about them. But they are rather rare.
There will always be exceptions, especially when it comes to human behavior and ability.

And IQ proponents usually acknowledge this weakness.

Tbh, a dig at the educational system is not threatening to IQ. The educational system usually ignores its existence in California

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5379248163687274d7510400#post_5379248163687274d7510400
Basically some people are insanely good at only certain things and not good at anything else.  Someone could master a entire orchestra of instruments and still be a "idiot".  Someone could discover the secret on how to make cold fusion, but still be a "idiot".

This explains a lot. I am _horrible_ at math and feel like a fool when it comes to philosophy and politics but mechanical design is where I shine. I designed an engine capable of producing over 5000 horsepower and can still fit in a normal car and be driven easily on the road daily and did so in under a week just for fun. Over 90% of the designing was all in my head.
